title: Build a unique, memorable web game with Internet Identity, progression, and leaderboards

requirements.text: Define and implement a complete, playable game concept (core loop, win/lose conditions, controls, scoring, and progression) designed to be easy to learn, hard to master, and suitable for broad popularity.

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: The app launches into a playable game experience with clear objective and controls.
A full round/session can be played from start to finish with deterministic win/lose/end conditions.
The game includes a scoring system and at least one progression mechanic (e.g., unlocks, levels, or upgrades) that affects gameplay.

requirements.text: Add an onboarding + home flow that explains the game in under 30 seconds (short interactive tutorial or step-by-step overlay), plus a clear Start/Retry loop.

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: First-time users see a concise tutorial or guided overlay and can dismiss/complete it.
Users can start a new run, pause (if applicable), and retry from a clear UI without page refresh.
All user-facing text is in English.

requirements.text: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and associate player profile data with the authenticated principal, including a public display name (editable) and basic stats (runs played, best score).

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: Users can sign in/out using Internet Identity.
Authenticated users can set/update a display name stored on the backend.
The backend persists per-user stats and returns them correctly after reload.

requirements.text: Create global and time-bounded leaderboards (e.g., all-time and daily/weekly) for best scores, with anti-spam validation (e.g., reject obviously invalid scores and rate-limit submissions per user).

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: Leaderboard screen shows at least all-time and one time-bounded board (daily or weekly).
Submitting a score updates the authenticated user’s entries and is visible on refresh.
Backend enforces basic validation (non-negative, within plausible max) and rate-limits score submissions per principal.

requirements.text: Add a “Daily Challenge” mode that uses a consistent seed/parameters per day so all players face the same challenge, with a dedicated daily leaderboard.

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: Daily Challenge parameters/seed are the same for all users on the same day and change on the next day.
Daily Challenge runs submit to a separate leaderboard from standard mode.
UI clearly distinguishes Standard mode vs Daily Challenge mode.

requirements.text: Add a lightweight social-sharing output without external integrations: generate a shareable results card view (score, mode, rank if available, and a short tagline) that users can copy as text and/or download as an image from the client.

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: After a run ends, a results view appears with score and mode and a short share text users can copy.
Users can download a results card image from the browser (client-side).
No third-party social APIs are required to use the sharing feature.

requirements.text: Create a coherent, distinctive visual theme (colors, typography, UI components, and game look) and apply it consistently across all screens; avoid a default/template look.

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: The UI has a consistent design system (typography scale, spacing, buttons, panels) across screens.
The game scene/board and UI share a unified theme and do not look like the unstyled starter template.
The chosen palette does not rely on a generic blue/purple gradient unless explicitly required (not required here).

requirements.text: Provide core screens and navigation: Home, Play (Standard), Play (Daily), Leaderboards, Profile/Stats, Settings (sound, accessibility options like reduced motion).

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: All listed screens exist and are reachable from the UI.
Settings include at least sound toggle and reduced motion toggle that affects animations.
Navigation is usable on both desktop and mobile viewports.

requirements.text: Ensure the backend actor exposes stable APIs for: getting/setting profile, submitting scores, fetching leaderboards, and fetching daily challenge parameters; store data persistently in canister state.

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: Backend provides query/update methods covering profile, score submission, leaderboard retrieval, and daily challenge retrieval.
Data persists across page reloads and canister calls within the same deployment.
All methods handle unauthenticated users appropriately (e.g., read-only access to leaderboards, restricted writes).

requirements.text: Add basic quality safeguards: loading/error states for all network calls, empty states for leaderboards, and a simple crash-safe fallback (if the game render fails, show an error panel and return to Home).

quotes: Make a game that will probably be famous someday

acceptanceCriteria: All backend-driven views show loading and error UI states.
Leaderboards show an empty-state message when there are no entries.
If the game fails to initialize, the UI shows a recoverable error with a way to return to Home.

constraints: Use a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo for all backend logic.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui; compose these components instead.
Do not edit frontend immutable hook paths (use existing hooks as-is and build features around them).
No external databases or third-party auth providers; use canister state + Internet Identity only.
No real-time multiplayer or WebSockets; design gameplay and competition to work asynchronously.
nonGoals: Integrations with external social media APIs for sharing.
External analytics, email, push notifications, or third-party backend services.

required: Game logo mark in a bold, iconic style (game-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero/banner illustration matching the game theme (hero-banner.dim_1600x900.png)
Set of 6 minimal in-game UI icons in a consistent style (ui-icons-sprite.dim_512x512.png)
